key_points: Dolph Lundgren expressed shock over the 'Rust' movie set shooting involving Alec Baldwin.
Lundgren emphasizes the seriousness of firearm safety on movie sets and the usual strict protocols.
He recalls a similar tragedy with Brandon Lee during 'The Crow' filming in 1993.
Lundgren, advocating for gun safety, mentions his own practice of dry fires and expects stricter safety measures.
For his directorial project 'Castle Falls,' Lundgren chooses CGI for gun scenes.
Alec Baldwin's shooting accident on 'Rust' set resulted in the death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and injured director Joel Souza.
Baldwin, handling a Colt revolver provided by assistant director Dave Halls, discharged a live round by accident.
Baldwin vowed cooperation with police investigation and expressed condolences to Hutchins' family.
Santa Fe County Sheriff's Department is conducting a criminal investigation into the incident.
Legal actions have been taken against Baldwin and other crew members by affected parties like script supervisor Mamie Mitchell and setâ€™s gaffer Serge Svetnoy.
spokespersons: Sheriff Adan Mendoza (Santa Fe County Sheriff's Department)
